meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a dunce.
meanings.sent1: The boy's duncish behavior in class made the teacher concerned.
meanings.sent2: Her duncish hat with a big propeller on top made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent3: Despite his duncish appearance, he was actually quite clever.
meanings.sent4: The duncish design of the building made it stand out in the city skyline.
meanings.sent5: The duncish look of the scarecrow made the birds stay away.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of intelligence or understanding.
meanings.sent1: The duncish mistake on the test was easily avoidable.
meanings.sent2: His duncish decision to wear shorts in the snow surprised everyone.
meanings.sent3: The duncish squirrel kept trying to climb the glass window.
meanings.sent4: Her duncish choice of words left everyone puzzled.
meanings.sent5: The duncish error in the recipe made the cake taste strange.
